text:
="preserve">Fiqh or Islamic jurisprudence () is an expansion of Sharia law and is meant to be used with fatwas by Islamic clerics (known as 'Ulema' in Arabic) to help Muslims not break Sharia law. Fiqh is a section of Islamic law which deals with acts of Muslim, that includes both worship and daily life actions.
The different schools of thought are not different beliefs but different views.
In Shia Islam there is one main school of thought, it is called Ja'fari
